alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Washington (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 02 at 3:14AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and northeast Kansas, including the following counties, in north central Kansas, Washington. In northeast Kansas, Marshall. * WHEN...Until 615 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 314 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Washington, Blue Rapids, Frankfort, Waterville, Greenleaf, Barnes and Lillis.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
